result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornelius D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cornelius D Smith in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Cornelius D Smith in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 40.
COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 33 days time served.   No huber privileges.   No electronic monitoring.   COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  STAYED. To be used at agent's discretion.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim(s) BLW, without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* No firearms; weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Cornelius D Smith not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Cornelius D Smith not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE KONKOL FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Court ordered the complaint amended to reflect the correct birthdate of the defendant, 8/10/1960.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $1000.00.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 07-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Cornelius D Smith
Current: 1525 North 24th Street, Milwaukee, WI   (Effective: 07-19-2015)
Prior: 4230 North 13th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with B.L.W.   AND/OR    S.H.H.    AND/OR   J.M.B.    AND/OR  their residences    AND/OR  their places of employment or school

Absolute Sobriety

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defense counsel requests adjournment for bail hearing.

Defendant Cornelius D Smith in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Cornelius D Smith in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Branch 40 for a Pretrial Conference.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
